text.0: i grasp at you when power and strength begin to dawn bedew ye indra and the maruts heaven and earth.
text.1: that day and night in every hall of sacrifice may wait on us and bless us when they first spring forth.
text.2: press the libation out most excellent of all the pressingstone is grasped like a handguided steed.
text.3: so let it win the valour that subdues the foe and the fleet coursers might that speeds to ample wealth.
text.4: juice that this stone pours out removes defect of ours as in old time it brought prosperity to man.
text.5: at sacrifices they established holy rites on tvaṣṭars milkblent juice bright with the hue of steeds.
text.6: drive ye the treacherous demons far away from us keep nirrti afar and banish penury.
text.7: pour riches forth for us with troops of hero sons and bear ye up o stones the song that visits gods.
text.8: to you who are more mighty than the heavens themselves who finishing your task with more than vibhvans speed.
text.9: more rapidly than vāyu seize the soma juice better than agni give us food to you i sing.
text.10: stirred be the glorious stones let it press out the juice the stone with heavenly song that reaches up to heaven.
text.11: there where the men draw forth the meath for which they long sending their voice around in rivalry of speed.
text.12: the stones press out the soma swift as carborne men and eager for the spoil drain forth the sap thereof.
text.13: to fill the beaker they exhaust the udders store as the men purify oblations with their lips.
text.14: ye present men have been most skilful in your work even ye o stones who pressed soma for indras drink.
text.15: may all ye have of fair go to the heavenly race and all your treasure to the earthly worshipper.
